title.narrative: PROGRAMME COORDINATION

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programmes are efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

participating-org.narrative: DREP DOSSO DREP MINISTERE DE LENSEIGNEMENT PRIMAIRE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: Le mécanisme renforcé de coordination du programme de coopération a maintenu l&39;environnement propice à une mise en œuvre efficace et à la performance du programme. Toutes les structures de coordination, y compris le;comité;technique de suivi, de pilotage;et les entités connexes, étaient pleinement fonctionnelles pour soutenir la mise en œuvre du programme. La gestion des partenariats et la mobilisation des ressources ont encore été améliorées, ce qui a permis d&39;augmenter le financement des interventions de développement et des interventions humanitaires. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022

title.narrative: Percentage of partners with full PSEA compliance, Percent
Percentage of partners with full PSEA compliance, Percent
Number of End-User Monitoring exercises completed for key inputs in the Nutrition section, Number
Percentage of UNICEF staff who received orientation in PEAS, Percent
Percentage of corrective actions implemented by the end of 2022, Percent
Percentage of national and international CSOs with an active partnership with UNICEF that have PEAS in the year 2022, Percent
Minimum number of annual visits to the warehouse for CMT members, Number
Number of joint programmes implemented in 2022, Number
Number of presentations and discussions in CMT, Number
Performance of UNDAF Cluster 4 for which UNICEF is the lead agency as measured by the implementation percentage of the annual cluster action plan, Text
Percentage of multisectoral workplan actions completed by the end of 2022, Text
Performance of joint programmes with UNICEF participation, measured as the rate of achievement of the annual work plan (including WFP and UNHCR), Text

A diagnosis, based on good practices at the regional level, is available on the costs/benefits of different approaches to programmatic/operational linkages between the central office and the field offices, with a recommendation adapted to realities, Text
CMT approved timelines and deadlines met, Text
Existence of a framework for dialogue and monitoring of the Common Chapter with UNDP, UN Women, UNFPA, Text
Existence of a roadmap for monitoring the management of mitigation measures, Text
Logistics operations in support of the government maintained at 100% under COVID-19, Text

A multi-sectoral partnership with community leaders (including traditional and religious leaders) that takes into account the need to mobilize for social change for the protection and promotion of children's rights is established, Text
A unified mechanism for monitoring KRC indicators at the sub-national level is implemented in partnership with local stakeholders, through the Field Offices, Text
Existence of strategic partnerships with the private sector is set up by the end of 2022, Text
Major risks selected for the development of a follow-up matrix of mitigation measures approved by the CMT, Text
Multi-sectoral workplans (1 per KRC) are established by the KRC groups, Text
Preparedness (donor mobilization and nutrition surveillance) and response (complementary actions in target geographical areas) to a food and nutrition crisis is done jointly with WFP and FAO, Text
